intro: Mundia albiflora, commonly known as white-flowered mundia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences, which bloom during the rainy season. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Mundia albiflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
